bibl.title: Sterling P. White v. Territory of Washington. Criminal
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Eastern Regional Branch
msIdentifier.collection: Spokane County Government; Clerk, Territorial Case Files, 1879-1889

div1.p:
TERRITORY OF WASHINGTON,
County of Spokane } SS.

Territory of Washington
Plaintiff
vs.
S.P. White
Defendant }
In the District Court of the Territory of Washington and for the Lincoln Judicial District thereof, holding terms at Cheney, Spokane County, in said Territory
To the Sheriff of Spokane Lincoln County, Greeting:

IN THE NAME OF THE UNITED STATES, You are hereby commanded to summon Elmer Warren to be and appear before the District Court aforesaid at the Court House, in Cheney, in said County, on the forthwith day of A.D. 1885, at o'clock, M. to there give evi- dence in the above entitiled cause on the part of said Defendant S.P. White
Witness the Hon. George Turner Associate Judge of the Supreme Court of Washington Territory, and Judge of said Court, and the Seal there- of affixed, this 17 day of April A.D. 1885

Kate W. Feauerbach Clerk.
By R. Dtrobach Deputy.

TERRITORY OF WASHINGTON,
County of Spokane Lincoln } SS.
I hereby certify that I served the within Subpoena on the within named witness by reading the same to him in said County, on this 23rd day of April A.D. 1885

Jno Cody Sheriff
By J.M. Friedlander, Deputy.
In the District Court of the Territory of Washington, and for the First Judicial District thereof, holding Terms at Cheney, Spokane County, in said Territory
Returned and Filed this 28 day of, April A.D. 1885

Kate W. Feuerbach Clerk.
By. R. Dtrobach Deputy.

Sheriff's Fees
Serving 1 names at 40 40
Mileage 2 miles at 10 20
Total, ---$ .60
